result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D. Alexander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

records.addlTxt: In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing
There is no Information to scan.  This is on court record card as the charges in the Amended Information that was filed on March 11, 2016 was not amended on that  date but was done on June 3, 2016.

Defendant Michael D. Alexander in court with attorney Andrew J. Jarmuz.  Defendant Michael D. Alexander in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1, Count 3 and Count 4 in Case No. 15CF71 and Count 2 in Case No. 15CF61.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty in Counts 1, 3 and 4 in Case No. 15CF71 and Count 2 in Case No. 15CF61.  Court dismisses and read in the remaining charges in 15CF71 and 15CF61.  Statements by Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Jarmuz.  Court orders in 15CF71 - Count 1 - 14 year prison sentence consisting of 6 years initial confinement and 8 years extended supervision.  Conditions of extended supervision - court costs, DNA sample and surcharge and counseling as deemed appropriate. Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program but not Challenge Incarceration program.  Court orders 261 days sentence credit.  Counts 3 and 4 are straight sentence of court costs.  Case No. 15CF61 - court orders court costs and six months county jail concurrent to 15CF71 and 14CF54.  Court also ordered that the clerk enter on the JOC that the State agrees to dismiss and read in uncharged case of intimidation of a witness and corresponding felony bail jumping and uncharged conspiracy to deliver meth which occurred between 2013 and September of 2015.  - rt
by B.J.R.

Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Court denies defense motion for State to disclose confidential informant.  - rt

Defendant Michael D. Alexander in court with attorney Andrew J. Jarmuz.  Defendant Michael D. Alexander in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called. Atty. Jarmuz acknowledges the notice. Atty. Jarmuz motions for dismissal of Count 5. Statement by Atty. Tlusty. Court dismisses Count 5. Reading of information waived. Court advises defendant of charges and penalties for Cases 15CF61 and 15CF71.  Defendant waives the time limits for a preliminary hearing. Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall have no contact with E.L.H. - dob: 5-5-1977.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael D. Alexander appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $10,000.00 cash bond; booking; no contact with E.L.H. - dob:  5-5-77; no possession or consumption of a controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Statement by the defendant.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court orders the clerk to begin bond revocations proceedings in Case No. 14CF54.  Next court date is October 20, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.  - rt
